name: Sniper Game but the Scope Actually Zooms In Instead of the Whole Screen
name_original: Sniper Game but the Scope Actually Zooms In Instead of the Whole Screen
description:
Robots are taking over!

3 robots, disguised as humans are being evil so the government came up with a plan to take them out, Operation: Use A Sniper Guy.

You are Dirk Thunderchad, a good sniper, not the best but a solid choice. Why you were chosen for this task over other more qualified ones is your gun scope actually zooms in instead of the whole screen making you the aesthetic choice.

You know how when you play games with a sniper rifle and sometimes instead of the scope zooming in the whole screen does? Then you become dramatic falling to your knees as you wonder how you could be born into a world that allows this to happen before composing yourself and continuing to play the game while a single tear drops down your face?

Well guess what! This game has a sniper rifle and it zooms in! You have three missions, each one is taking out an evil robot mastermind. There's a new game+ if you beat each mission with some extra features.

Anyway, if you want to know why game scopes usually do this, here are some reasons:

  • You have to render the screen twice.
  • Slows down performance.
  • It can cause motion sickness.
  • Engine limitations.
  • The effect's processing power can be used on better things.
  • Literally no one cares.

Controls:

  • Move: WASD
  • Look: Mouse
  • Zoom: Right Mouse
  • Fire: Left Mouse
  • Jump: Space
  • ESC: Pause
